decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The goal is to quickly build a board presence with efficient creatures like Guide of Souls and Seasoned Pyromancer, while also utilizing burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. Additionally, strategic cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison help disrupt the opponent's game plan, allowing this deck to stay ahead and secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on ramping quickly into big threats like Primeval Titan and Valakut, while using Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana from lands entering the battlefield untapped. It also utilizes cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Scapeshift to find key pieces and combo off for a game-winning play. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently, overwhelming opponents with powerful threats and explosive plays. It also includes utility lands like Urza's Saga and Tolaria West to help find key cards and enable the deck's strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to be highly aggressive and focus on quickly getting Arclight Phoenix onto the battlefield. This is achieved through cards like Faithless Looting, Manamorphose, and Dragon's Rage Channeler to quickly cycle through the deck and get the Phoenix in the graveyard. The deck also includes other aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Nethergoyf to put pressure on the opponent. Additionally, there are burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to finish off the opponent quickly. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells.

This deck focuses on using mana ramp and control spells to quickly bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. The deck also includes cards like Nulldrifter and Sowing Mycospawn to draw cards and generate tokens for additional advantage. By ramping up mana quickly and controlling the board with spells like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures and powerful abilities.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of powerful control cards across multiple colors to create a versatile and adaptive strategy. By leveraging cards like Teferi, Time Raveler, Wrenn and Six, and Prismatic Ending, the deck aims to exert control over the board and disrupt opponents' plans. Additionally, the inclusion of strong threats like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Grist, the Hunger Tide provides a win condition. With a mix of removal, card advantage, and strong creatures, the deck seeks to outlast opponents and establish dominance over the game.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful cards like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift, allowing for explosive plays that can win the game in a single turn. Utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor and Arboreal Grazer to accelerate mana production, along with lands like Vesuva and Gruul Turf to generate additional value, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its speed and efficiency. By chaining together multiple land drops and tutor effects, the deck can assemble a deadly combo that can close out the game in spectacular fashion.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through disruption and removal spells, while also utilizing card draw and graveyard interaction. The goal is to protect key threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and hand disruption. By efficiently removing threats and maintaining card advantage, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and ultimately win through powerful creatures like Murktide Regent or through chip damage from creatures like Abhorrent Oculus. The mana base is built to consistently cast spells and access all necessary colors for the deck's strategy.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting opponents through counterspells and removal while leveraging card advantage and graveyard interaction. The deck utilizes efficient cheap counterspells like Spell Snare and Force of Negation to control the board, along with removal spells like Fatal Push. Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog provide threats and card advantage, while Unearth and Cling to Dust offer graveyard recursion and utility. The deck aims to outvalue opponents through card advantage and disruption, ultimately controlling the game and grinding out a win.

The main idea of this deck is to assemble the Broodscale Bloodchief combo utilizing cards such as Karn, the Great Creator, Blade of the Bloodchief, and Glaring Fleshraker. The goal is to control the board with cards like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command while setting up the combo pieces. Ancillary cards like Soul-Guide Lantern and Walking Ballista provide additional utility and interaction. The land base is built to support the combo pieces and provide consistency in casting spells. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo and overwhelm opponents with its synergies.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures that can be searched for and put into play using various tutoring effects like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith. The combo potential comes from using creatures like Prime Speaker Vannifar and Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker to create powerful synergies for explosive plays. The deck also includes disruption elements like Collector Ouphe and Wall of Roots to control the board and protect the combo pieces. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a diverse array of threats and combo potential.

This Orzhov Midrange deck focuses on using aggressive creatures and disruption spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck includes a mix of creatures with enter-the-battlefield abilities, such as Skyclave Apparition and Tidehollow Sculler, alongside powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and Ephemerate to reuse their abilities, the deck aims to generate value and out-tempo the opponent. With a mix of creature threats and disruption spells, the deck can adapt to various matchups and strategies in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on playing explosive threats like Hollow One and Detective's Phoenix early in the game to quickly pressure the opponent and close out the game. It also utilizes cards like Burning Inquiry and Faithless Looting to fill the graveyard and power up Nethergoyf, while also enabling the graveyard synergies of the deck. The inclusion of cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Bloodstained Mire help maintain card advantage and ensure a consistent stream of threats to keep the pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this Modern 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly generate mana using cards like Desperate Ritual, Pyretic Ritual, and Ruby Medallion, in order to cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames. The deck also includes ways to draw cards and manipulate the top of the library with cards like Glimpse the Impossible and Valakut Awakening. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of burn spells and card advantage.

This deck aims to quickly put pressure on the opponent through a combination of aggressive creatures and removal spells. By using cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp, it gains value by blinking creatures with powerful enter the battlefield effects. The Orzhov color combination allows for disruption through cards like Tidehollow Sculler and Skyclave Apparition, while also providing a solid mana base. The deck's strategy is to control the board and chip away at the opponent's life total, ultimately overwhelming them with efficient threats and removal.
